item.title: Israel Gaza war: Hamas says 70 killed in Israeli air strike on camp
item.description: Gaza's Hamas-run health ministry says the death toll could rise further at the Al-Maghazi refugee camp.

item.title: Manchester United: Sir Jim Ratcliffe agrees deal to buy 25% stake
item.description: British billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe agrees a deal to buy a 25% stake in Manchester United from the Glazer family.

item.title: Ukraine celebrates first Christmas on 25 December
item.description: The move to the Western calendar is seen as a further shift away from Moscow's influence.

item.title: Serbia protests: Anti-government demonstrators try to storm Belgrade City Hall
item.description: The opposition demands a re-run of last week's elections which its say were marred by fraud.

item.title: Sara Sharif: UK and Pakistan courts tussle over siblings' future
item.description: Legal cases are examining where the siblings of the 10 year old found dead at her home in Surrey will live.

item.title: Watch: Kate surprises young footballer and his coach at party
item.description: Rico's coach Russell Gray was also at the event and joked he was 'hoodwinked' into meeting the princess.

item.title: Banksy: Second arrest after artwork removed in Peckham
item.description: Another suspect was also held on suspicion of theft and criminal damage but has now been bailed.

item.title: Christmas Eve: Hottest since 1997 after 15.3C recorded near Heathrow
item.description: Mild conditions lay the groundwork for what forecasters say could be the hottest Christmas Day since 2016.

item.title: Cardiff: Llandaff Christmas Eve murder inquiry arrest
item.description: A 23-year-old man is arrested on suspicion of murder after another man was found in Llandaff.

item.title: Slovakia arrest over threat to copy Prague attack
item.description: The suspect said he wanted to repeat Thursday's shooting in neighbouring Czech Republic, police say.

item.title: Man dies after Dublin restaurant shooting
item.description: A man in his 20s has been killed and a second man is seriously injured.

item.title: Tanker hit off India coast by drone from Iran, says US
item.description: Saturday's attack caused a fire on board the chemical tanker in the Indian Ocean, the US military says.

item.title: Christmas message: King Charles poses alongside replantable tree
item.description: The King will deliver his traditional festive messages besides a tree which will be reused next year.

item.title: Jim Ratcliffe: Who is the man buying Man Utd stake?
item.description: One of the UK's richest men, Sir Jim has built a multi-billion pound business by snapping up unloved assets.

item.title: Kidney donation: 'Giving a stranger this gift has changed my life'
item.description: Laura Maisey says giving away one of her organs has been the best thing that has ever happened to her.

item.title: Film 2024: Mean Girls, Wicked, Dune Part Two and other highlights
item.description: Paddington in Peru and Amy Winehouse biopic Back To Black are among the other big screen releases.

item.title: EastEnders: The cheat's guide to the Christmas special
item.description: If you've not been keeping track of the soap throughout the year, here's what you need to know.

item.title: Cat makes history in Sydney to Hobart yacht race
item.description: Oli is believed to be the first feline seafarer in the famous race's 78-year history.

item.title: 'Bethlehem is empty of joy - no Santa, no celebration'
item.description: The West Bank city of Bethlehem, usually bustling at this time of year, is subdued as war goes on in Gaza.

item.title: Doctor Who: Welsh landscapes the perfect backdrop, says Ncuti Gatwa
item.description: New Doctor Ncuti Gatwa says the "mythical landscapes of Wales" are also stars of the show.

item.title: BBC News Quiz of the Year, part four: Who did Beyonce thank for her Renaissance?
item.description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

item.title: It's A Wonderful Life: The Borders village linked to a movie classic
item.description: Why is Birgham in the Scottish Borders "twinned" with the fictional town in It's A Wonderful Life?

item.title: Sri Lanka: Thousands arrested in week-long anti-drug operation
item.description: Almost 15,000 suspected criminals and addicts are detained in a week-long operation, police say.

item.title: Two in court over Limerick €21m cocaine seizure
item.description: Two men are in court after an estimated 300kg of cocaine was seized from a cargo ship.

item.title: Cologne Cathedral: Extra checks at German landmark after attack warning
item.description: German police are deployed near the cathedral, amid fears of attacks in several European countries.

item.title: Dixie Chicks band founding member Laura Lynch dies in car crash
item.description: The former member of the US country music band dies after being involved in a two-vehicle crash in Texas.

item.title: Alabama mother: Joy as babies born to mum with rare double womb
item.description: Kelsey Hatcher has given birth in Alabama twice in two days - after a 'one in a million' pregnancy.

item.title: Guyana: UK to send warship to South America amid Venezuela tensions
item.description: HMS Trent will visit South America as a show of support for the former British colony, the BBC learns.

item.title: Call for more action on 'pernicious' romance fraud
item.description: The government's anti-fraud champion Simon Fell says victims of relationship swindlers require more help.

item.title: Two teenagers killed in three-vehicle crash in Cramlington
item.description: An 18-year-old and a 15-year-old died and two other males were seriously injured, police say.

item.title: Blitz Bazawule - the Ghanaian who dazzled Beyoncé takes on The Color Purple
item.description: Blitz Bazawule, who grew up in Ghana, is behind a new adaptation of iconic book The Color Purple.

item.title: Wolves 2-1 Chelsea: Hosts condemn wasteful Chelsea to defeat
item.description: Wolves condemn wasteful Chelsea to another defeat in the Premier League thanks to goals from Mario Lemina and Matt Doherty.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Deontay Wilder fight slips away again but Briton emerges as biggest winner
item.description: Anthony Joshua emerges as the biggest winner from a revolutionary card in Saudi Arabia as a possible Deontay Wilder fight slips away again.

item.title: Sir Jim Ratcliffe at Man Utd: Transfer window; Erik ten Hag; Jadon Sancho - what happens next?
item.description: What happens in the January transfer window? What about Old Trafford improvements? What about Erik ten Hag's future? Assessing the key issues for Sir Jim Ratcliffe at Man Utd.

item.title: India register their first women's Test win over Australia with eight-wicket victory in Mumbai
item.description: India registered their first women's Test win over Australia with an eight-wicket victory in a one-off match in Mumbai.

item.title: Motherwell 0-2 Rangers: Philippe Clement's side back to within two points of Celtic
item.description: Rangers return to within two points of Celtic with a game in hand as they see off a Motherwell side now winless in 15.

item.title: Man United: Sir Jim Ratcliffe 'a great backer' who 'understands sport', says Ineos Team UK's Ben Ainslie
item.description: Speaking to BBC's sport editor Dan Roan, Ineos Team UK principal Ben Ainslie says Sir Jim Ratcliffe is a "a great backer" who "understands sport".

item.title: PDC World Championship 2024: Nathan Aspinall beaten by Ricky Evans
item.description: World number six Nathan Aspinall is out of the PDC World Darts Championship after a shock 3-0 defeat by Ricky Evans at London's Alexandra Palace.

item.title: How to save money even when the budget is tight
item.description: The interest paid on savings is better than anything seen for years, so how can you save when bills are rising?

item.title: Buy now, pay later: Things you need to know about the loan schemes
item.description: With the winter sales season in full swing here's what you need to know before borrowing money.

item.title: How much will your Christmas dinner cost this year?
item.description: The rising price of turkey has slowed, while the cost of mince pies are up by 25%.

item.title: Energy saving scheme: What is the Demand Flexibility Service?
item.description: A scheme to reward people for cutting back on electricity use is running for a second day this week.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.
